00033 /**
00034  * \file
00035  *      SD driver implementation using SPI.
00036  * \author
00037  *      Nicolas Tsiftes <nvt@sics.se>
00038  */
00039 
00040 #include "contiki.h"
00041 #include "sd.h"
00042 #include "sd-arch.h"
00043 
00044 #include <io.h>
00045 #include <string.h>
00046 
00047 #define DEBUG 0
00048 #if DEBUG
00049 #include <stdio.h>
00050 #define PRINTF(...) printf(__VA_ARGS__)
00051 #else
00052 #define PRINTF(...)
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 #ifndef MIN
00056 #define MIN(a, b)       ((a) < (b) ? (a) : (b))
00057 #endif /* MIN */
00058 
00059 #define SPI_IDLE        0xff
00060 
00061 /* SD commands */
00062 #define GO_IDLE_STATE           0
00063 #define SEND_OP_COND            1
00064 #define SWITCH_FUNC             6
00065 #define SEND_IF_COND            8
00066 #define SEND_CSD                9
00067 #define SEND_CID                10
00068 #define STOP_TRANSMISSION       12
00069 #define SEND_STATUS             13
00070 #define READ_SINGLE_BLOCK       17
00071 #define WRITE_BLOCK             24
00072 #define READ_OCR                58
00073 
00074 /* SD response lengths. */
00075 #define R1                      1
00076 #define R2                      2
00077 #define R3                      5
00078 #define R7                      5
00079 
00080 #define START_BLOCK_TOKEN       0xfe
00081 
00082 /* Status codes returned after writing a block. */
00083 #define DATA_ACCEPTED           2
00084 #define DATA_CRC_ERROR          5
00085 #define DATA_WRITE_ERROR        6
00086 
00087 static uint16_t rw_block_size;
00088 static uint16_t block_size;
00089 
00090 static int read_register(int register_cmd, char *buf, int register_size);
00091 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00092 static int
00093 send_command(uint8_t cmd, uint32_t argument)
00094 {
00095   uint8_t req[6];
00096 
00097   req[0] = 0x40 | cmd;
00098   req[1] = argument >> 24;
00099   req[2] = argument >> 16;
00100   req[3] = argument >> 8;
00101   req[4] = argument;
00102   /* The CRC hard-wired to 0x95 is only needed for the initial 
00103      GO_IDLE_STATE command. */
00104   req[5] = 0x95;
00105 
00106   sd_arch_spi_write(SPI_IDLE);
00107   sd_arch_spi_write_block(req, sizeof(req));
00108   sd_arch_spi_write(SPI_IDLE);
00109 
00110   return 0;
00111 }
00112 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00113 static uint8_t *
00114 get_response(int length)
00115 {
00116   int i;
00117   int x;
00118   static uint8_t r[R7];
00119 
00120   for(i = 0; i < SD_READ_RESPONSE_ATTEMPTS; i++) {
00121     x = sd_arch_spi_read();
00122     if((x & 0x80) == 0) {
00123       /* A get_response byte is indicated by the MSB being 0. */
00124       r[0] = x;
00125       break;
00126     }
00127   }
00128 
00129   if(i == SD_READ_RESPONSE_ATTEMPTS) {
00130     return NULL;
00131   }
00132 
00133   for(i = 1; i < length; i++) {
00134     r[i] = sd_arch_spi_read();
00135   }
00136 
00137   return r;
00138 }
00139 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00140 static unsigned char *
00141 transaction(int command, unsigned long argument,
00142         int response_type, unsigned attempts)
00143 {
00144   unsigned i;
00145   unsigned char *r;
00146 
00147   LOCK_SPI();
00148   r = NULL;
00149   for(i = 0; i < attempts; i++) {
00150     LOWER_CS();
00151     send_command(command, argument);
00152     r = get_response(response_type);
00153     RAISE_CS();
00154     if(r != NULL) {
00155       break;
00156     }
00157   }
00158   UNLOCK_SPI();
00159 
00160   return r;
00161 }
00162 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00163 int
00164 sd_initialize(void)
00165 {
00166   unsigned char reg[16];
00167   int i;
00168   uint8_t *r, read_bl_len;
00169 
00170   if(sd_arch_init() < 0) {
00171     return SD_INIT_ERROR_ARCH;
00172   }
00173 
00174   if(SD_CONNECTED() < 0) {
00175     return SD_INIT_ERROR_NO_CARD;
00176   }
00177 
00178   r = transaction(GO_IDLE_STATE, 0, R1, SD_TRANSACTION_ATTEMPTS);
00179   if(r != NULL) {
00180     PRINTF("Go-idle result: %d\n", r[0]);
00181   } else {
00182     PRINTF("Failed to get go-idle response\n");
00183   }
00184 
00185   r = transaction(SEND_IF_COND, 0, R7, SD_TRANSACTION_ATTEMPTS);
00186   if(r != NULL) {
00187     PRINTF("IF cond: %d %d %d %d %d\n", r[0], r[1], r[2], r[3], r[4]);
00188   } else {
00189     PRINTF("failed to get IF cond\n");
00190     return SD_INIT_ERROR_NO_IF_COND;
00191   }
00192 
00193   LOCK_SPI();
00194 
00195   for(i = 0; i < SD_TRANSACTION_ATTEMPTS; i++) {
00196     LOWER_CS();
00197     send_command(SEND_OP_COND, 0);
00198     r = get_response(R1);
00199     RAISE_CS();
00200     if(r != NULL && !(r[0] & 1)) {
00201       break;
00202     }
00203   }
00204 
00205   UNLOCK_SPI();
00206 
00207   if(r != NULL) {
00208     PRINTF("OP cond: %d (%d iterations)\n", r[0], i);
00209   } else {
00210     PRINTF("Failed to get OP cond get_response\n");
00211   }
00212 
00213   LOCK_SPI();
00214 
00215   for(i = 0; i < SD_TRANSACTION_ATTEMPTS; i++) {
00216     LOWER_CS();
00217     send_command(READ_OCR, 0);
00218     r = get_response(R3);
00219     RAISE_CS();
00220     if(r != NULL) {
00221       break;
00222     }
00223   }
00224 
00225   UNLOCK_SPI();
00226 
00227   if(r != NULL) {
00228     PRINTF("OCR: %d %d %d %d %d\n", r[0], r[1], r[2], r[3], r[4]);
00229   }
00230 
00231 
00232   if(read_register(SEND_CSD, reg, sizeof(reg)) < 0) {
00233     PRINTF("Failed to get block size of SD card\n");
00234     return SD_INIT_ERROR_NO_BLOCK_SIZE;
00235   }
00236 
00237   read_bl_len = reg[5] & 0x0f;
00238   block_size = 1 << read_bl_len;
00239   rw_block_size = (block_size > SD_DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE) ?
00240                         SD_DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE : block_size;
00241   PRINTF("Found block size %d\n", block_size);
00242 
00243   /* XXX Arbitrary wait time here. Need to investigate why this is needed. */
00244   MS_DELAY(5);
00245 
00246   return SD_OK;
00247 }
00248 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00249 int
00250 sd_write_block(sd_offset_t offset, char *buf)
00251 {
00252   unsigned char *r;
00253   int retval;
00254   int i;
00255   unsigned char data_response;
00256   unsigned char status_code;
00257 
00258   LOCK_SPI();
00259   r = NULL;
00260   retval = SD_WRITE_ERROR_NO_CMD_RESPONSE;
00261   for(i = 0; i < SD_TRANSACTION_ATTEMPTS; i++) {
00262     LOWER_CS();
00263     send_command(WRITE_BLOCK, offset);
00264     r = get_response(R1);
00265     if(r != NULL) {
00266       break;
00267     }
00268     RAISE_CS();
00269   }
00270 
00271   if(r != NULL && r[0] == 0) {
00272     /* We received an R1 response with no errors.
00273        Send a start block token to the card now. */
00274     sd_arch_spi_write(START_BLOCK_TOKEN);
00275 
00276     /* Write the data block. */
00277     sd_arch_spi_write_block(buf, rw_block_size);
00278 
00279     /* Get a response from the card. */
00280     retval = SD_WRITE_ERROR_NO_BLOCK_RESPONSE;
00281     for(i = 0; i < SD_TRANSACTION_ATTEMPTS; i++) {
00282       data_response = sd_arch_spi_read();
00283       if((data_response & 0x11) == 1) {
00284         /* Data response token received. */
00285         status_code = (data_response >> 1) & 0x7;
00286         if(status_code == DATA_ACCEPTED) {
00287           retval = rw_block_size;
00288         } else {
00289           retval = SD_WRITE_ERROR_PROGRAMMING;
00290         }
00291         break;
00292       }
00293     }
00294   }
00295 
00296   RAISE_CS();
00297   UNLOCK_SPI();
00298 
00299   return retval;
00300 }
00301 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00302 static int
00303 read_block(unsigned read_cmd, sd_offset_t offset, char *buf, int len)
00304 {
00305   unsigned char *r;
00306   int i;
00307   int token;
00308   int retval;
00309 
00310   LOCK_SPI();
00311 
00312   r = NULL;
00313   for(i = 0; i < SD_TRANSACTION_ATTEMPTS; i++) {
00314     LOWER_CS();
00315     send_command(read_cmd, offset);
00316     r = get_response(R1);
00317     if(r != NULL) {
00318       break;
00319     }
00320     RAISE_CS();
00321   }
00322 
00323   if(r != NULL && r[0] == 0) {
00324     /* We received an R1 response with no errors.
00325        Get a token from the card now. */
00326     for(i = 0; i < SD_TRANSACTION_ATTEMPTS; i++) {
00327       token = sd_arch_spi_read();
00328       if(token == START_BLOCK_TOKEN || (token > 0 && token <= 8)) {
00329         break;
00330       }
00331     }
00332 
00333     if(token == START_BLOCK_TOKEN) {
00334       /* A start block token has been received. Read the block now. */
00335       for(i = 0; i < len; i++) {
00336         buf[i] = sd_arch_spi_read();
00337       }
00338 
00339       /* Consume CRC. TODO: Validate the block. */
00340       sd_arch_spi_read();
00341       sd_arch_spi_read();
00342 
00343       retval = len;
00344     } else if(token > 0 && token <= 8) {
00345       /* The card returned a data error token. */
00346       retval = SD_READ_ERROR_TOKEN;
00347     } else {
00348       /* The card never returned a token after our read attempts. */
00349       retval = SD_READ_ERROR_NO_TOKEN;
00350     }
00351 
00352     RAISE_CS();
00353     UNLOCK_SPI();
00354     return retval;
00355   }
00356 
00357   RAISE_CS();
00358   UNLOCK_SPI();
00359 
00360   if(r != NULL) {
00361     PRINTF("status during read: %d\n", r[0]);
00362   }
00363 
00364   return SD_READ_ERROR_NO_CMD_RESPONSE;
00365 }
00366 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00367 int
00368 sd_read_block(sd_offset_t offset, char *buf)
00369 {
00370   return read_block(READ_SINGLE_BLOCK, offset, buf, rw_block_size);
00371 }
00372 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00373 static int
00374 read_register(int register_cmd, char *buf, int register_size)
00375 {
00376   return read_block(register_cmd, 0, buf, register_size);
00377 }
00378 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00379 sd_offset_t
00380 sd_get_capacity(void)
00381 {
00382   unsigned char reg[16];
00383   int r;
00384   uint16_t c_size;
00385   uint8_t c_size_mult;
00386   sd_offset_t block_nr;
00387   sd_offset_t mult;
00388 
00389   r = read_register(SEND_CSD, reg, sizeof(reg));
00390   if(r < 0) {
00391     return r;
00392   }
00393 
00394   c_size = ((reg[6] & 3) << 10) + (reg[7] << 2) + ((reg[8] >> 6) & 3);
00395   c_size_mult = ((reg[9] & 3) << 1) + ((reg[10] & 0x80) >> 7);
00396   mult = 1 << (c_size_mult + 2);
00397   block_nr = (c_size + 1) * mult;
00398 
00399   return block_nr * block_size;
00400 }
00401 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00402 char *
00403 sd_error_string(int error_code)
00404 {
00405 #if DEBUG
00406   switch(error_code) {
00407   case SD_OK:
00408     return "operation succeeded";
00409   case SD_INIT_ERROR_NO_CARD:
00410     return "no card was found";
00411   case SD_INIT_ERROR_ARCH:
00412     return "architecture-dependent initialization failed";
00413   case SD_INIT_ERROR_NO_IF_COND:
00414     return "unable to obtain the interface condition";
00415   case SD_INIT_ERROR_NO_BLOCK_SIZE:
00416     return "unable to obtain the block size";
00417   case SD_WRITE_ERROR_NO_CMD_RESPONSE:
00418     return "no response from the card after submitting a write request";
00419   case SD_WRITE_ERROR_NO_BLOCK_RESPONSE:
00420     return "no response from the card after sending a data block";
00421   case SD_WRITE_ERROR_PROGRAMMING:
00422     return "the write request failed because of a card error";
00423   case SD_WRITE_ERROR_TOKEN:
00424     return "the card is not ready to grant a write request";
00425   case SD_READ_ERROR_NO_TOKEN:
00426   case SD_WRITE_ERROR_NO_TOKEN:
00427     return "did not receive a start block token";
00428   case SD_READ_ERROR_INVALID_SIZE:
00429     return "invalid read block size";
00430   case SD_READ_ERROR_TOKEN:
00431     return "the card is not ready to read a data block";
00432   case SD_READ_ERROR_NO_CMD_RESPONSE:
00433     return "no response from the card after submitting a read request";
00434   default:
00435     break;
00436   }
00437 #endif
00438   return "unspecified error";
00439 }
00440 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00441 int
00442 sd_write(sd_offset_t offset, char *buf, size_t size)
00443 {
00444   sd_offset_t address;
00445   uint16_t offset_in_block;
00446   int r, i;
00447   size_t written;
00448   size_t to_write;
00449   char sd_buf[rw_block_size];
00450 
00451   /* Emulation of data writing using arbitrary offsets and chunk sizes. */
00452   memset(sd_buf, 0, sizeof(sd_buf));
00453   written = 0;
00454   offset_in_block = offset & (rw_block_size - 1);
00455 
00456   do {
00457     to_write = MIN(size - written, rw_block_size - offset_in_block);
00458     address = (offset + written) & ~(rw_block_size - 1);
00459 
00460     for(i = 0; i < SD_READ_BLOCK_ATTEMPTS; i++) {
00461       r = sd_read_block(address, sd_buf);
00462       if(r == sizeof(sd_buf)) {
00463         break;
00464       }
00465     }
00466     if(r != sizeof(sd_buf)) {
00467       return r;
00468     }
00469 
00470     memcpy(&sd_buf[offset_in_block], &buf[written], to_write);
00471     r = sd_write_block(address, sd_buf);
00472     if(r != sizeof(sd_buf)) {
00473       return r;
00474     }
00475     written += to_write;
00476     offset_in_block = 0;
00477   } while(written < size);
00478 
00479   return written;
00480 }
00481 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00482 int
00483 sd_read(sd_offset_t offset, char *buf, size_t size)
00484 {
00485   size_t total_read;
00486   size_t to_read;
00487   char sd_buf[rw_block_size];
00488   uint16_t offset_in_block;
00489   int r, i;
00490 
00491   /* Emulation of data reading using arbitrary offsets and chunk sizes. */
00492   total_read = 0;
00493   offset_in_block = offset & (rw_block_size - 1);
00494 
00495   do {
00496     to_read = MIN(size - total_read, rw_block_size - offset_in_block);
00497     for(i = 0; i < SD_READ_BLOCK_ATTEMPTS; i++) {
00498       r = sd_read_block((offset + total_read) & ~(rw_block_size - 1), sd_buf);
00499       if(r == sizeof(sd_buf)) {
00500         break;
00501       }
00502     }
00503     if(r != sizeof(sd_buf)) {
00504       return r;
00505     }
00506 
00507     memcpy(&buf[total_read], &sd_buf[offset_in_block], to_read);
00508     total_read += to_read;
00509     offset_in_block = 0;
00510   } while(total_read < size);
00511 
00512   return size;
00513 }
